channel.title: Elevation with Steven Furtick
channel.description: Welcome to the weekly podcast of Elevation Church led by Pastor Steven Furtick. To learn more visit our website at http://elevationchurch.org or download the Elevation App. To support this ministry and help us continue to reach people all around the world click here
channel.itunes:author: Elevation Church

item.title: Not Something, But Someone (Still In It)
item.itunes:title: Not Something, But Someone (Still In It)
item.description:
Pastor Steven shares a simple truth that can help you endure life’s hardest trials. True security isn't the absence of trouble; it’s the presence of a Savior who promises you’ll never walk through it alone.

If you’ve just made a decision for Christ, please respond HERE: ele.vc/tIepfr

Scripture References: Isaiah 43, verses 1-2 Acts 3, verses 5-6 1 Peter 4, verses 12-13 Daniel 3, verses 15-26
item.content:encoded:
Pastor Steven shares a simple truth that can help you endure life’s hardest trials. True security isn't the absence of trouble; it’s the presence of a Savior who promises you’ll never walk through it alone.

If you’ve just made a decision for Christ, please respond HERE: ele.vc/tIepfr

Scripture References:
Isaiah 43, verses 1-2
Acts 3, verses 5-6
1 Peter 4, verses 12-13
Daniel 3, verses 15-26

item.title: When Waiting Isn’t Working (Muddy Moves)
item.itunes:title: When Waiting Isn’t Working (Muddy Moves)
item.description:
Ever feel like you’re stuck in a season that isn’t moving? God may not be asking you to wait; He may be asking you to act. If you’ve been delaying your next step because it’s messy, uncomfortable, or imperfect, this message will help you move forward.

If you’ve just made a decision for Christ, please respond HERE: ele.vc/tIepfr

Scripture References: John 9, verses 1-11 John 8, verses 58-59 2 Corinthians 12, verses 8-9

item.title: Put Your Passion In Its Place
item.itunes:title: Put Your Passion In Its Place
item.description:
When used properly, passion can be a powerful tool. But what about when it seems like you’ve lost your passion? Learn how to find your passion again and put it in its place.

If you’ve just made a decision for Christ, please respond HERE: ele.vc/tIepfr

Scripture References:

Revelation 2, verses 2-5 

1 Timothy 1, verse 3

item.title: More Ready Than You Recognize
item.itunes:title: More Ready Than You Recognize
item.description:
Feeling unsure doesn’t mean you’re unprepared. God often provides what you need before you feel confident enough to use it. This message will help you recognize the strength, wisdom, and support God’s already given you for the season you’re in.

If you’ve just made a decision for Christ, please respond HERE: ele.vc/tIepfr

Scripture References: Matthew 7, verses 24-29 Mark 8, verses 14-22 1 Chronicles 29, verses 1-2 1 Samuel 17, verses 33-40 Matthew 16, verses 16-18

item.title: It's Worth The Dirt
item.itunes:title: It's Worth The Dirt
item.description:
Wondering if you should give up because progress feels slow? Wisdom isn’t choosing what’s easiest, it’s choosing what’s worth it. If you’re tempted to quit because it’s hard, remember: God uses pressure and patience to prepare you for something greater.

If you’ve just made a decision for Christ, please respond HERE: ele.vc/tIepfr

Scripture References: Matthew 13, verses 31-32, 44 Genesis 2, verse 7

item.title: Don’t Forget Where You Come From
item.itunes:title: Don’t Forget Where You Come From
item.description:
Feeling like you don’t have enough? God has given you an inheritance, so don’t let pressure shrink your perspective or make you forget who you are. The God who brought you this far is more than capable of driving out what’s in your way.

If you’ve just made a decision for Christ, please respond HERE: ele.vc/tIepfr

Scripture References: Joshua 17, verses 14-18 Ephesians 1, verse 18 Genesis 41, verses 50-51

item.title: Don't Let The Attack Distract You
item.itunes:title: Don't Let The Attack Distract You
item.description:
Right when you start to feel some positive momentum in your life, an attack comes out of nowhere. Sound familiar? Pastor Steven uses the parable of the seeds to illustrate what to do when the enemy attacks and how to persevere in your purpose.

If you’ve just made a decision for Christ, please respond HERE: ele.vc/tIepfr

Scripture References: Matthew 13, verses 24-30, 36-43 2 Samuel 16, verses 5-12

item.title: Expecting Change (Jonathan Josephs)
item.itunes:title: Expecting Change (Jonathan Josephs)
item.description:
God doesn’t just want to “fix” you, He wants to restore you. Right now, He’s transforming you to impact others. Expect more than a personal breakthrough; expect God to exceed your expectations and bless others through your life.

If you’ve just made a decision for Christ, please respond HERE: ele.vc/tIepfr

Scripture References:

Acts 3, verses 1-12, 16

item.title: Blessed Because You Believe (Holly Furtick)
item.itunes:title: Blessed Because You Believe (Holly Furtick)
item.description:
We live in a time when it’s getting harder and harder to believe things. But it’s so important to remember that in a world full of illusion and deception, God is still true. Pastor Holly Furtick shares from Mary’s perspective some truths about God we can believe as we cling to faith this Christmas. If you’ve just made a decision for Christ, please respond HERE: ele.vc/tIepfr

Scripture References: Luke 1, verses 34-45  Luke 1, verses 26-30 John 16, verse 13  Luke 1, verses 8-13

item.title: God Prompts (Mary’s Prayer)
item.itunes:title: God Prompts (Mary’s Prayer)
item.description:
We often ask God to do what we want, but faith starts with doing what He says. When you trust God as your good Father and follow His prompting, even small steps can unlock something big.

If you’ve just made a decision for Christ, please respond HERE: http://ele.vc/tIepfr

item.title: This May Be Plan C
item.itunes:title: This May Be Plan C
item.description:
What do you do when things don’t go according to plan? There might be some things in your path you didn’t expect, and it might be taking longer than you thought, but God’s got you covered. Watch the message to see why you’re still going to get there. 

If you’ve just made a decision for Christ, please respond HERE: ele.vc/tIepfr

Scripture References: Philippians 3, verses 10-14 Exodus 13, verses 17-18 Exodus 3, verse 7 Exodus 14, verses 16-30

item.title: This Is Then (God Uses Stupid)
item.itunes:title: This Is Then (God Uses Stupid)
item.description:
Some things look “stupid” to the world… until God uses them to change everything. If you’ve been holding back because you need everything to make sense, this will call you to trust what God promised and practice gratitude in the hard place.

If you’ve just made a decision for Christ, please respond HERE: ele.vc/tIepfr

Scripture References: Genesis 28, verses 13-22 Matthew 21, verse 42

item.title: This Is The Time (Jonathan Josephs)
item.itunes:title: This Is The Time (Jonathan Josephs)
item.description:
We all have areas of our lives that we treat with urgency and diligence, and others that we procrastinate. Pastor Jonathan Josephs gives us instruction from the book of Haggai on the blessing that follows when we align our priorities with God’s and move forward in obedience. If you’ve just made a decision for Christ, please respond HERE: ele.vc/tIepfr

Scripture References: Haggai 1, verses 1-8

item.title: Your Next Messy Step
item.itunes:title: Your Next Messy Step
item.description:
This message is for when life feels uncertain and you’re not sure what God wants you to do next. We often look for strategy or certainly, but God’s looking for surrender. Pastor Steven teaches from the life of Jacob how to take the next “messy” step.

If you’ve just made a decision for Christ, please respond HERE: http://ele.vc/tIepfr

Scripture References: Genesis 28, verses 10-22 John 1, verses 50-51

item.title: The War Of Whispers
item.itunes:title: The War Of Whispers
item.description:
Ever feel like there are too many voices telling you what to do and who to be? The enemy whispers fear, doubt, and distraction, but God’s whisper brings peace, purpose, and direction. When you stop agreeing with the enemy’s lies and start trusting the whisper of the One who sent you, you’ll find confidence in where — and who — you are.

If you’ve just made a decision for Christ, please respond HERE: ele.vc/tIepfr 

Scripture References: John 7, verses 1-16 Isaiah 54, verse 17 John 6, verse 66

item.title: Your Label Is Lying
item.itunes:title: Your Label Is Lying
item.description:
This sermon is for someone who has been hearing the same lies from the enemy for so long that you’ve started to believe them. But you are not your issue. You are not your bad decision. It’s time to interrupt your story with truth and leave the lies behind, because the Word says otherwise. If you’ve just made a decision for Christ, please respond HERE: http://ele.vc/tIepfr

Scripture References: John 5, verses 1-11

item.title: All In (Larry Brey)
item.itunes:title: All In (Larry Brey)
item.description:
Ever feel like you’ve let God in, but still hold certain things back? He won’t force His way in, but when you open the door, He can heal what’s been hidden. Going all in isn’t about perfection; it’s about letting Jesus have access to every part of you.

If you’ve just made a decision for Christ, please respond HERE: ele.vc/tIepfr

item.title: Keep It In Context
item.itunes:title: Keep It In Context
item.description:
When you feel surrounded by pressure and fear, it’s easy to lose perspective. But what if God’s already provided the help you’ve been praying for? Keep it in context: the battle isn’t proof you’re losing, it’s evidence that you’re carrying something worth fighting for.

“He who is in you is greater than he who is in the world.” – 1 John 4, verse 4 (KJV) If you’ve just made a decision for Christ, please respond HERE: ele.vc/tIepfr

Scripture References: 2 Kings 6, verses 8-17 Romans 8, verse 18 1 John 4, verse 4 Genesis 37, verses 16-18

item.title: Not Here
item.itunes:title: Not Here
item.description: Do you ever feel like your prayers are going unanswered? The enemy wants you to believe God’s not listening, but the truth is He hears you. His presence is with you in the mountains and the valleys, and He’s working one moment at a time. If you’ve just made a decision for Christ, please respond HERE: ele.vc/tIepfr Scripture References: Psalm 120, verses 1-7 1 John 5, verses 14-15 John 20, verses 11-17
item.content:encoded:
Do you ever feel like your prayers are going unanswered? The enemy wants you to believe God’s not listening, but the truth is He hears you. His presence is with you in the mountains and the valleys, and He’s working one moment at a time.

item.title: Not As Long As My Song!
item.itunes:title: Not As Long As My Song!
item.description:
Hitting your limit isn’t a sign of weakness; it’s an invitation to shift your perspective. When the enemy brings the battle to your mind, remember that he only attacks what’s valuable. And God’s goodness is your secret weapon to win the fight. 

If you’ve been asking God:

How long is this going to last? How long am I going to be sick? How long am I going to suffer? How long before I can let go? How long before I find someone? How long until this struggle is over?  How long until I feel okay again? 

Then this message is for you. 

If you’ve just made a decision for Christ, please respond HERE: ele.vc/tIepfr

Scripture References: Psalm 13, verses 1-6 1 Samuel 17, verses 34-35, 50 Ephesians 6, verse 12  1 Chronicles 28, verses 11-12

If you’ve just made a decision for Christ, please respond HERE: ele.vc/tIepfr

item.description:

Things really can change for you. Your past is not your prophecy. Stop allowing fear to predict your future, and begin to see it how God sees it. Pastor Jabin Chavez encourages us: “It’s Not Over.”

Do The New You is available for purchase wherever you get books. Go to http://dothenewyou.com to get your copy today.

To support this ministry and help us continue to reach people all around the world click here: http://www.elevationchurch.org/giving/

item.title: OFF MENU
item.itunes:title: OFF MENU
item.description:
In “OFF MENU,” Pastor Steven Furtick reminds us that even though we might not feel ready for this season of our lives, God has already prepared us for the exact assignment that we are designed to accomplish.

Ghost Writer is a brand-new series about making sense of your story through the lens of the Holy Spirit.
